Name: Matt Schillerstrom
Job: Director Product Management and Product Marketing
Note: One of the very first SREday Ambassadors, I helped bring the conference to San Francisco and kick things off on the West Coast. I have been friends with Miko and Mark since way back, so being part of this from the early days felt natural and exciting. I am genuinely happy to help kick off the SREday + Harness partnership and see where this community keeps growing next.
Speaker: SREday San Francisco

Name: Leon Adato
Note: I have been following SREday closely for years and have watched it grow from a small, focused event into something with real momentum. I have spoken at most of the locations along the way, which gave me a front row seat to how the conversations and the community keep evolving. I am here because I care about helping the developer community grow in a way that stays practical, curious, and human.
Speaker: All SREday locations

Name: Bas van Alphen
Note: I am involved in organizing SREday Amsterdam at ING, mainly focusing on the practical side of making it all run smoothly. That meant logistics, speaker coordination, and yes, making sure everyone was well fed and caffeinated. I also joined a panel discussion on the state of reliability practices and tooling in banks, which sparked some honest and interesting conversations about where we are, what still hurts, and what is slowly getting better.
Speaker: SREday Amsterdam

Name: William Ravensbergen
Note: I co-organized the very first SREday hosted at ING Amsterdam. I worked closely with the SREday team to shape a speaker lineup that felt thoughtful, practical, and genuinely useful for people doing the work day to day. Being part of this from the inside was energizing, and I am genuinely happy to keep showing up and helping the SRE community grow in ways that feel grounded and welcoming.
Speaker: SREday Amsterdam, SREday London

Name: Rod Anami
Note: I've co-organized SREday Campinas, the first conference of the series in Latin America. Being part of an event of this magnitude reinforced my belief that strong communities are built by trust, collaboration, and an amazing team working toward a shared goal. I am grateful to everyone who helped make SREday Campinas possible and truly memorable!
Speaker: SREday San Francisco, SREday Campinas

Name: Balaji Venkatesan
Note: I’m excited to partner with SREday for the first SREday India edition in Chennai. Through my work at GuhaTek, I help organizations operationalize reliability by connecting SRE principles, observability, and chaos engineering to real business outcomes, not just tooling. For me, SRE is about engineering discipline, shared responsibility, and continuous improvement, and communities like SREday help make that real at scale. We’re proud to support this initiative and committed to growing the SREday community across cities in India, creating spaces for practitioners to connect, exchange ideas, and learn from each other.
Speaker: SREday Chennai

Name: Clarence Selestin
Note: Reliability at scale only matters when it shows up for real users, and that’s why SREday India resonates with me. Leading global SRE for Ford’s eCommerce platforms has reinforced that resilience is built through strong engineering fundamentals, operational discipline, and shared ownership across teams. Events like SREday create the space to move beyond theory, talk honestly about failures, and learn what actually works in production. I’m glad to support this first India edition in Chennai and excited to see the community grow across cities as more practitioners come together to raise the bar on reliability.
Speaker: SREday Chennai

Name: Siva Bagavathi
Note: I’m happy to be partnering with SREday to bring the series of conferences to India. As Co-Founder of GuhaTek, I work closely with engineering teams on SRE, SLO-driven reliability, chaos engineering, and observability, with a strong focus on learning from real incidents and building resilient systems. I believe meaningful engineering communities are built on trust, openness, and shared learning, not just tools or frameworks. We’re excited to support SREday India and look forward to growing this community across cities in India, creating a space where practitioners can learn from each other and raise the reliability bar together.
Speaker: SREday Chennai
